materials.raw_text: 7 g of Arsenic (As), 3 g of Lithium (Li), 1 g of Sodium (Na), 9 g of Nickel (Ni), 1 g of Yttrium (Y)

sourcing.instructions: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical suppliers; Lithium from battery manufacturers or chemical suppliers; Sodium from chemical suppliers; Nickel from metal suppliers; Yttrium from chemical suppliers. Ensure all materials are of high purity.
steps: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical suppliers; Lithium from battery manufacturers or chemical suppliers; Sodium from chemical suppliers; Nickel from metal suppliers; Yttrium from chemical suppliers. Ensure all materials are of high purity.

1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. Combine As, Li, Na, Ni, and Y in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder for uniformity. 4. Transfer the blended powder to a ceramic crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a precision scale. 2. Combine As, Li, Na, Ni, and Y in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder for uniformity. 4. Transfer the blended powder to a ceramic crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C (1472°F). 2. Place the ceramic crucible in the furnace and hold at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C (1472°F). 2. Place the ceramic crucible in the furnace and hold at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 22°C or 72°F). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 22°C or 72°F). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. If required, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. If required, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
